sen.j: 池坊 保子（いけのぼう やすこ、1942年4月18日 ‐）は、日本の政治家。
sen.e: Yasuko IKENOBO (April 18, 2942 -) is a Japanese politician.
Yasuko IKENOBO (April 18, 1942 -) is a Japanese politician.
Yasuko IKENOBO (April 18, 1942 -) is a Japanese politician.

sen.j: 公明党所属の国会議員（4期）。
sen.e: She is a member of the Diet and belongs to the New Komei Party (fourth period).
She is a member of the Diet and belongs to the New Komei Party (fourth period).
She is a member of the Diet and belongs to the New Komeito Party (fourth period).
sen.cmt: 公明党→New Komeito Partyとしました。

sen.j: 華道家。
sen.e: She is also a flower arrangement expert.
She is also an expert at flower arrangement.
She is also an expert at flower arrangement.

sen.j: 貴族院 (日本)（子爵・旧羽林家）梅渓通虎の三女として東京都に生まれる。
sen.e: Yasuko IKENOBO was born in Tokyo Prefecture as the third daughter of Michitora UMETANI, who was a member of the House of Peers (in Japan) (a viscount and a descendant of the former Urin family).
Yasuko IKENOBO was born in Tokyo Prefecture as the third daughter of Michitora UMETANI, who was a member of the House of Peers (in Japan) (a viscount and a descendant of the former Urin family).
Yasuko IKENOBO was born in Tokyo as the third daughter of Michitora UMETANI, who was a member of the House of Peers (Japan) (a viscount and a descendant of the former Urin family).
sen.cmt: 東京都→Tokyo としました（prefectureは削除しました）。

sen.j: 今上天皇の続柄に当たる。
sen.e: She is a relative of the current Emperor Akihito.
She is a relative of the current Emperor Akihito.
She is a relative of the current Emperor Akihito.

sen.j: 学習院初等科・学習院女子中等科・学習院女子高等科を経て学習院大学文学部日本文学に入学。
sen.e: After being educated at Gakushuin Primary School, Gakushuin Girls' Junior and Senior High Schools, Yasuko IKENOBO entered the Department of Japanese Language and Literature of the Gakushuin University Faculty of Letters.

After being educated at Gakushuin Primary School and Gakushuin Girls' Junior and Senior High Schools, Yasuko IKENOBO entered the Department of Japanese Language and Literature of the Gakushuin University Faculty of Letters.

After being educated at Gakushuin Primary School and Gakushuin Girls' Junior and Senior High Schools, Yasuko IKENOBO entered the Department of Japanese Language and Literature of the Gakushuin University Faculty of Letters.

sen.j: 1961年に大学を中退した後、1963年池坊の家元・華道家主要な華道家と結婚する。
sen.e: Dropping out of university in 1961, she married Senei IKENOBO, the head of the Ikenobo School of Flower Arrangement.
sen.cmt: 「池坊の家元・華道家主要な華道家」は、もとのWikipediaでは「池坊の家元・池坊専永」となっていますので、そのように訳しました．
sen.e: Dropping out of university in 1961, she married Senei IKENOBO, the head of the Ikenobo School of Flower Arrangement.
Dropping out of university in 1961, she married Senei IKENOBO, the head of the Ikenobo School of Flower Arrangement in 1963.

sen.j: 夫・専永との間に長女・池坊専好（現・次期家元、華道家元池坊副理事、池坊中央研修学院長）、次女・池坊美佳（現・池坊青年部代表）をもうけた。
sen.e: She and her husband Senei had two daughters: the eldest daughter, Senko IKENOBO (currently designated as the next head of the Ikenobo School, former Ikenobo Deputy Director and President of the Ikenobo Center Institute) and the second daughter, Mika IKENOBO (current Representative of the Ikenobo Youth group).

She and her husband Senei have two daughters: the eldest daughter, Senko IKENOBO (currently designated as the next head of the Ikenobo School, former Ikenobo Deputy Director and President of the Ikenobo Center Institute) and the younger daughter, Mika IKENOBO (current Representative of the Ikenobo Youth group).

She and her husband Senei have two daughters: the eldest daughter, Yuki IKENOBO (Senko IKENOBO) (currently designated as the next head of the Ikenobo School, former Ikenobo Deputy Director and President of the Ikenobo Center Institute) and the younger daughter, Mika IKENOBO (current Representative of the Ikenobo Youth group).
sen.cmt: 「長女 池坊専好」 ですが、後述に 「長女 由紀」とも出てきますので、こちらでも「池坊由紀」を追加しました（原文のwikiでも、「由紀」となっています）。

sen.j: 結婚後は若くして家元の夫人となり、世界に華道の名を広めた。
sen.e: After her marriage, she worked to spread the flower arrangement art worldwide as the young wife of the head of the Ikenobo School.
After her marriage, she worked to spread the flower arrangement art worldwide as the young wife of the head of the Ikenobo School.
After her marriage, she worked to spread the flower arrangement art worldwide as the young wife of the head of the Ikenobo School.

sen.j: その後は池坊学園理事、学園長として夫・専永を支えた。
sen.e: She subsequently served as the Director and President of Ikenobo College to support her husband Senei.
She subsequently served as the Director and President of Ikenobo College to support her husband Senei.
She subsequently served as the Director and President of Ikenobo College to support her husband Senei.

sen.j: 選挙には長女・由紀の夫で元大蔵省官僚の池坊雅史が出馬した（落選）ことから、当時の新進党から比例代表制（名簿1位）からの出馬要請があり、1996年の第41回衆議院議員総選挙で初当選。
sen.e: After Masafumi IKENOBO, the husband of her eldest daughter Yuki, who formerly worked as a government official in the Finance Ministry, was defeated in an election, Yasuko IKENOBO was requested by the New Frontier Party at the time to run as a candidate for a proportional representation election (ranked first on the list of candidates) and was elected as a representative for the first time in 1996 in the 41st general election of the members of the House of Representatives.

After Masafumi IKENOBO, the husband of her eldest daughter Yuki, who formerly worked as a government official in the Finance Ministry, was defeated in an election, Yasuko IKENOBO was requested by the then New Frontier Party to run as a candidate for a proportional representation election (ranked first on the list of candidates) and she was elected as a representative for the first time in 1996 in the 41st general election of the members of the House of Representatives.

After Masafumi IKENOBO, the husband of her eldest daughter Yuki, who formerly worked as a government official in the Finance Ministry, was defeated in an election, Yasuko IKENOBO was requested by the then New Frontier Party to run as a candidate for a proportional representation election (ranked first on the list of candidates) and she was elected as a representative for the first time in 1996 in the 41st general election of the members of the House of Representatives.

sen.j: 党解党後は自ら公明党および公明党へ行くことを決意。
sen.e: When the New Frontier Party was dissolved, she chose to change her political affiliation to the New Heiwa Party, and then to the New Komeito Party.
sen.cmt: 「自ら公明党および公明党」はもとのWikipediaでは「自ら新党平和および公明党」となっていますので、そのように訳しました。
sen.e: When the New Frontier Party was dissolved, she chose to change her political affiliation to the New Heiwa Party, and then to the New Komeito Party.
When the New Frontier Party was dissolved, she chose to change her political affiliation to the New Heiwa Party, and then to the New Komeito Party.

sen.j: 公明党で唯一、創価学会の会員以外の衆議院議員となった（国会議員では党副代表草川昭三が創価学の会員ではない）。
sen.e: Consequently, she became the only member of the House of Representatives from the New Komeito Party who was not affiliated with Soka Gakkai (among members of the Diet, Shozo KUSAKAWA, the Vice President of the New Komeito Party, is not affiliated with Soka Gakkai).

Consequently, she became the only member of the House of Representatives from the New Komeito Party who was not affiliated with Soka Gakkai (among members of the Diet, Shozo KUSAKAWA, the Vice President of the New Komeito Party, is not affiliated with Soka Gakkai).

Consequently, she became the only member of the House of Representatives from the New Komeito Party who was not affiliated with Soka Gakkai (among members of the Diet, Shozo KUSAKAWA, the Vice President of the New Komeito Party, is not affiliated with Soka Gakkai).

sen.j: 長女・由紀は1991年に元大蔵省官僚の雅史と、次女・美佳は2000年に日本放送協会の記者と結婚した。
sen.e: Her eldest daughter, Yuki, married Masayuki, a former government official of the Finance Ministry, in 1991, and her second daughter, Mika, married a reporter of NHK (Japan Broadcasting Corporation) in 2000.

Her eldest daughter, Yuki, married Masayuki, a former government official of the Finance Ministry, in 1991, and her second daughter, Mika, married a reporter of NHK (Japan Broadcasting Corporation) in 2000.

Her eldest daughter, Yuki, married Masafumi, a former government official of the Finance Ministry, in 1991, and her second daughter, Mika, married a reporter of NHK (Japan Broadcasting Corporation) in 2000.
sen.cmt: 雅史→Masafumi と修正しました。

sen.j: 主に教育分野で活動しており、文部科学大臣大臣政務官や衆議院文部科学委員会委員長なども務めた。
sen.e: Yasuko IKENOBO is active mainly in education areas, and has served as the Parliamentary Secretary for Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology and as the Chairperson of the Committee on Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of the House of Representatives.
sen.cmt: 文部科学大臣大臣政務官→Parliamentary Secretary for Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology[以下のサイトを参照しました。http://www.cas.go.jp/jp/seisaku/hourei/name.pdf]文部科学委員会委員長→Chairperson of Committee on Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology
sen.e: Yasuko IKENOBO is active mainly in education areas, and has served as the Parliamentary Secretary for Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology and as the Chairperson of the Committee on Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of the House of Representatives.

Yasuko IKENOBO is active mainly in education areas, and has served as the Parliamentary Secretary for Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology and as the Chairperson of the Committee on Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of the House of Representatives.

sen.j: 2008年、党女性委員会副委員長、党京都府本部顧問を務める。
sen.e: In 2008, she was nominated as the Vice-Chairperson of the Women's Committee of the New Komeito Party and served as a special adviser of the party headquarters in Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 女性委員会副委員長→vVice-Chairperson of the Women's Committee of the New Komeito Party
sen.e: In 2008, she was nominated the Vice-Chairperson of the Women's Committee of the New Komeito Party and served as a special adviser of the party headquarters in Kyoto Prefecture.
In 2008, she was nominated the Vice-Chairperson of the Women's Committee of the New Komeito Party and served as a special adviser of the party headquarters in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 講談社の雑誌「ペントハウス」1984年3月号でセミヌード写真を披露して物議をかもした。
sen.e: She presented semi-nude photos of herself in the 1984 March issue of the Kodansha's magazine, "Penthouse," causing a scandal.
She presented semi-nude photos of herself in the 1984 March issue of the Kodansha's magazine, "Penthouse," causing a scandal.
She presented semi-nude photos of herself in the 1984 March issue of the Kodansha's magazine, 'Penthouse,' causing a scandal.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。
